page.title: 14Community Council
page.content: Local government in the UK is divided into three tiers: County, District and Community or Parish Councils. In Wales the first level is called the Community Council. The area in which we live is covered by the Trellech United Community Council. There are ll Council members who are elected every four years. The ward which covers Catbrook is represented by four Councillors and also includes The Narth and part of Trellech itself. The Council meets once a month in full session and discusses matters like planning applications, preservation of buildings and historical landmarks, the general administration of the area and also takes up issues and complaints on behalf of local residents with the larger local authorities.
